result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas E Parr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
*Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
*Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
*DNA sample, pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).

*NO firearms; weapons.
*Due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

*No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
*Parties may text or call only for purposes of child visitation.
*Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order.

*Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.   Continue with treatment.
*Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
*Complete a parenting class.
*Other than taking prescription drugs, in the manner in which they were prescribed, maintain absolute sobriety.
*Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
*Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: Time is stayed pending review on 12/04/15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas E Parr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas E Parr in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Nicholas E Parr in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  
*
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Rebecca P.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12/04/15.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.   Continue with treatment.     
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Other than taking prescription drugs, in the manner in which they were prescribed, maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Parties may text or call only for purposes of child visitation.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Cash bail on deposit to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-DNA sample, pay the surcharge.  Court advised defendant he may qualify to have DNA sample expunged if the conditions are met under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas E Parr in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Argument heard.  Court denied defense motion to modify the no contact order.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

15RM033983  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-18-2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with R.B.P. (8/3/88) AND J.D.P (3/5/13). 
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nicholas E Parr in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Nicholas E Parr in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss by defense FOR LACK OF PROBABLE CAUSE argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
